quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Election and Man
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, people, nixon. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 1964, Barry Goldwater lost the election in a landslide to Lyndon Baines Johnson. Name Goldwaters running mate who was the father of a radio talk show host.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Miller

questions.question: Who won the Nobel Peace Prize for the first time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both of them

questions.question: In 1992, third-party candidate Ross Perot chose this admiral to be his running mate.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Stockdale

questions.question: Who was the first man to climb to the top of Mount Everest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sir Edmond Hillary

questions.question: In 1972, George McGovern lost in a landslide to Richard Nixon. His first nominee for VP, was on the ticket for about two weeks, before being withdrawn amid allegations that he had undergone psychiatric hospitalization. Who was this first nominee?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Eagleton

questions.question: When Gerald Ford ran for President in 1976, he replaced the incumbent vice president with this man. The ticket was unsuccessful, losing to Jimmy Carter in the election.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Dole

questions.question: This man was Al Gores running mate in the 2000 elections.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Lieberman

questions.question: In 1960, Richard Nixon lost the election to John F. Kennedy. This former UN Ambassador was Nixons running mate.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry Cabot Lodge, Jr.

questions.question: Who became the first man to run the mile in less then four minutes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roger Bannister

questions.question: In 1968, Hubert Humphrey lost to Richard Nixon in the presidential election. This former governor and senator from Maine was his running mate.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edmund Muskie

questions.question: In 1984, former veep Walter Mondale lost the presidential election in a landslide to Ronald Reagan. Who was Mondales running mate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Geraldine Ferraro

questions.question: In 1968, third-part segregationist candidate George Wallace drew support from a large number of Southern Democratism and ended up with 46 electoral votes. His running mate was this Air Force General.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Curtis Lemay

questions.question: In August of 1972, George McGovern nominated a second person as his running mate, who was on the ticket through the election. This man is the father-in-law of a US state governor. Who was the running mate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sargent Shriver

questions.question: In 1988, this vice presidential candidate (who ultimately lost the election) made waves when he told another candidate in a debate, Senator, youre no Jack Kennedy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lloyd Bentsen

questions.question: This former pro football player was the vice presidential candidate for the losing side in 1996.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Kemp

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Man and Idi Amin
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which Emperor created Imperial China?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Qin Shi Huang

questions.question: Who was the first man to swim the English Channel unaided?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Matthew Webb

questions.question: Idi Amin was a member of this tribe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kakwa

questions.question: Which king of Israel captured Jerusalem and made it the capital of his kingdom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David

questions.question: Idi Amin was president of this African nation.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Uganda

questions.question: Ashoka the Great ruled during the Indian Golden Age. When was it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: III century BC

questions.question: Hamurabi, who is known for one of the first written civil codes, called Hammurabis Code, ruled this ancient empire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Babylon

questions.question: What was the title of Hisham ibn Abd al-Malik, the great ruler of the Umayyad dynasty?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Caliph

questions.question: Henry the Navigator, who initiated European worldwide expansion, was king of this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Portugal

questions.question: Which of these monarchs holds the distinction of ruling the biggest empire in terms of land area?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George V of Great Britain

questions.question: Which ruler introduced the metric system in much of Europe?

options.text: Wladyslaw II Jagiello of Poland and Lithuania

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Napoleon Bonaparte of France

questions.question: Who was the first man to walk in space?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexi Leonov

questions.question: Who is the only monarch of England to be called the Great?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alfred

questions.question: Who was the first man to fly over the North Pole?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roald Amundsen

questions.question: Who is considered the first Roman Emperor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Octavian Augustus

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Idi Amin and Gerald Ford
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, leader, adopt. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Idi Amin expressed admiration for this German leader.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adolf Hitler

questions.question: This man served as an aide to Idi Amin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Astles

questions.question: In November 1978 Idi Amins troops invaded this nation launching a war.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tanzania

questions.question: Idi Amin was the tennis champion of Uganda from 1954 to 1958.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: After being overthrown Idi Amin first went to this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Libya

questions.question: What nickname did Idi Amin adopt?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Big Daddy

questions.question: Which two George W. Bush cabinet members served with President Gerald Ford?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rumsfeld and Cheney

questions.question: What college did Gerald Ford attend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yale

questions.question: In January of 1971 Idi Amin came to power by overthrowing this president.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Milton Obote

questions.question: In 1972 Idi Amin expelled these people from his country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Asians

questions.question: Idi Amin once challenged this African leader to a boxing match.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Julius Nyerere

questions.question: Critics of Gerald Ford point out that he lost his bid for the presidency in 1976 for what reason?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Nixon pardon

questions.question: What British colonial regiment did Idi Amin join in 1946?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kings African Rifles

questions.question: What actor portrayed Idi Amin in the movie The Last King of Scotland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Forest Whitaker

questions.question: There is a breast cancer clinic named after Gerald Fords wife.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Alexander and City
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, bucephalus. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What city was the capital of the ancient kingdom of Macedon when Alexander the Great was born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pella

questions.question: What was Alexander the Greats legendary horse, Bucephalus, afraid of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: his shadow

questions.question: What statement is true about the Wars of the Diadochi following Alexander the Greats death?

options.text: The term refers to the Battle of the Hydaspes River and the Battle of Gaugamela in which Alexanders army was led by his generals.
The term refers to the conflicts between the Ptolemaic Kingdom and the Roman Empire.
The term refers to the conflicts among Alexanders successors.
The term refers to the wars between the Greek city-states and the Roman Empire.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The term refers to the conflicts among Alexanders successors.

questions.question: Alexander the Greats mother, Olympias, claimed that this deity was Alexanders father.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zeus

questions.question: Alexander the Greats friendship with this Macedonian nobleman and general was compared to that of Achilles and Patroclus.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hephaestion

questions.question: Which of Alexander the Greats generals became ruler of Egypt after Alexanders death and took the title of pharaoh?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ptolemy

questions.question: What trio of actors starred as Alexander the Great, King Philip II of Macedon and Queen Olympias in Oliver Stones 2004 movie Alexander?

options.text: Brad Pitt, Christopher Plummer, Angelina Jolie
Colin Farrell, Peter OToole, Catherine Zeta Jones
Colin Farrell, Val Kilmer, Angelina Jolie
Colin Farrell, Anthony Hopkins, Angelina Jolie

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Colin Farrell, Val Kilmer, Angelina Jolie

questions.question: What Roman Emperor is said to have taken Alexander the Greats armor from his tomb in Alexandria, Egypt?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Caligula

questions.question: In what month was the 26th President of the United States Theodore Roosevelt born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: October

questions.question: Gerald R. Ford nearly ran on the Republican ticket as a vice president in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1980

questions.question: Which of these politicians was Gerald R. Fords stiffest challenge in the Republican race in 1976?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronald Reagan

questions.question: Prior to becoming President, Gerald R. Ford served in U.S. Congress representing what state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michigan

questions.question: Gordium, the city where according to legend Alexander the Great undid the intricate Gordian Knot, was the capital of this ancient kingdom.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phrygia

questions.question: James Earl Carter defeated Gerald Ford in the 1976 Presidential election.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What Persian king did Alexander the Great defeat at the Battle of Issus (333 BC) and at the Battle of Gaugamela (331 B)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Darius

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Theodore Roosevelt and President
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, people, theodore. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who was the 4th president of the USA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Madison

questions.question: This diverse trio of Geminis were born on May 24th. One is a prominent folk singer (1941), the other one is a soulful songstress dubbed The Empress of Soul (1944) and the third one is the daughter of a country/rock and roll music legend (1955).

options.text: Bob Dylan, Patti LaBelle, Roseanne Cash
Woody Guthrie, Patti LaBelle, Roseanne Cash
Muddy Waters, Aretha Franklin, Roseanne Cash
Bob Dylan, Mary J Blige, Carlene Cash

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Dylan, Patti LaBelle, Roseanne Cash

questions.question: Theodore Roosevelt was the first president to have a car, be submerged in a submarine, and own a telephone.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Where was George Washington, Americas first president, born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Virginia

questions.question: All of the following share the same birth date of June 21st, but were they all born in the 60-year period between 1925 and 1985?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: The 26th President of the United States, Theodore Roosevelt was very interested in mathematics during his childhood.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What was Theodore Roosevelts position during the Spanish-American war?

options.text: He did not participate in the Spanish-American.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A rough rider

questions.question: With which two figures from Greek/Roman mythology is Gemini associated?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Castor and Pollux

questions.question: What university/college did Theodore Roosevelt attend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harvard

questions.question: Which of these is the correct period of Theodore Roosevelts presidency?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1901-1909

questions.question: Prince, Tom Jones and Liam Neeson were all born on June 7th but in different years.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Theodore Roosevelt was very athletic and engaged in sports as a child.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: After his first wife’s death, Theodore Roosevelt went through another personal tragedy – his favorite son committed suicide. Where did this happen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alaska

questions.question: What was the name of Theodore Roosevelts second wife?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edith

questions.question: After Theodore Roosevelt’s first wife died, he married a childhood sweetheart.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Pirates and President
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, john, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Richard Nixon was the 35th president of the United States.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This sea captain, privateer and politician of the Elizabethan era was second-in-command of the English fleet against the Spanish Armada in 1588. He was respected as a hero by the English, but Spaniards considered him a pirate.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Francis Drake

questions.question: Who was the 40th president of the USA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronald Reagan

questions.question: When was John F. Kennedy assassinated?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1963

questions.question: Franklin D. Roosevelt was a New York state senator, before he became president of the United States.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Ronald Reagan worked as a radio sports announcer after graduating from college.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What was the nickname of Edward Teach, the notorious English pirate who was active in the Caribbean Sea and western Atlantic during the Golden Age of Piracy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blackbeard

questions.question: Who wrote the adventure novel Treasure Island which tells the story of pirates and buried gold?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Louis Stevenson

questions.question: What term is applied to pirate flags which often featured skeletons, daggers, cutlasses, skulls and crossbones?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jolly Roger

questions.question: The city of Port Royal, known for Gallows Point where many pirates were executed, is located on what Caribbean Island?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jamaica

questions.question: What English pirate captain employed in his crew the only two female pirates of the Golden Age of Piracy – Anne Bonny and Mary Read?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Calico Jack (Jack Rackham)

questions.question: What was Richard Nixons middle name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Milhous

questions.question: Hayreddin Pasha, a Turkish pirate, who dominated the Mediterranean for decades, was nicknamed Barbarossa. What is the meaning of his nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: red beard

questions.question: Abraham Lincoln was shot by John Wilkes Booth.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Herbert Hoover directed the American Relief Committee.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True
